page.title: 14FISH IN ABBERTON RESERVOIR
page.content: Abberton Reservoir is an ideal habitat for freshwater fish. Plantlife and insects are abundant, providing food for a large population. Angling takes place on those banks of the reservoir which are not too steep. All common species of fish are represented: Pike, Perch, Roach, Tench, Eel and Bream. Some of the fish are very large. Pike have been seen that are as large as a ten year old boy is tall and as thick as a man's thigh. The maximum weight of a pike caught in the reservoir is 33 pounds. In the summer months algae forms over a large area of the surface of the water and this nourishes the insect population and in turn benefits the fish.
